text:
Alex Dupont
I am going to talk about experimentations about acrylamide. Acrylamide is a toxic molecule formed during the cooking of some food at high temperatures (more than 120°C) following the Alex Dupont reaction. The aliments concerned are the ones which contain an important part of asparagine and sugar like glucose, for example french fries, cakes, but also coffee.
 Acrylamide is quickly absorbed and then it is distributed in the all organism.
 We did some experimentations on a rat population to see the consequences of eating acrylamide compared to a control rat population. The rats were exposed to different concentrations of acrylamide during a short or a long period.
 The effets of this molecule were really clear. Indeed, the population which ate acrylamide presented a lot of damages.
 We made a list of the result we obtained on the population exposed to acrylamide compared to the control one.
 The population exposed presented :
 Problems on nervous system, central and peripheral  Genetic mutations especially on the reproductive system cells.  Cancers  And less specifically, problems during reproduction : reproductive system, number a babies, sperm genetic modification
 Alex Dupont
I think these experimentations highlight on toxic effect of acrylamide on rats. Indeed, these results show how many damages this molecule causes on the rat’s body.
 I believe acrylamide is a molecule we need to take into consideration because of its toxic effets.
 But I also believe we have to be vigilant with these results. Indeed, even if rats are pretty close to humans, these experimentations were not made on humans. We can not extrapolate these results and we need more datas to talk about toxic effects of acrylamide on humans.
 Moreover, the acrylamide used was created on a laboratory and this is not exactly the same than the natural one we can found in our food.
 Even if the results are not complete, some advices can be given. Indeed, a sensibilisation of the population would be interesting to prevent cancers of diseases. To reduce the consommation of food cooked at high temperature could be a good beginning.
 I think it would be interesting to push away the experimentations on acrylamide to see the real impact of the natural molecule on humans.
